fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When upgrading with the installer and selecting the old installation directory, users receive "The target installation directory is not empty."

Users have to choose an empty directory to place the new install files. This can sometimes break custom tasks / startup scripts, which then need to be updated for the new installation directory.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow users to replace existing install directory when upgrading.
fields.summary: Installer: Option to replace the existing install directory during an upgrade

fields.description:
It would be helpful to have a place to review every branch while we're working on them so that we can use the browser-based diff utility and comment/collaborate as we normally would on a pull request.   Right now we have to create a pull request and then say "hey this isn't really a pull request, I just need some feedback on the work I've done so far."

Perhaps in the "Branches" page under the triple-dot menu you could add something like "Create Review Page" so that only the branches people are requesting a review on would show up and notify reviewers (see attachment r1.png).  Then users could also see reviews that have updates in their sidebar (see attachment r2.png).

I realize that it almost acts as duplicate functionality of pull request, so I'm hoping you might know of a better way to give this functionality without cluttering up the UI.  You could add it to the pull requests page, for example, and simply organize the whole page with pull requests on top and review requests below them (see attachment r3.png).
fields.summary: Per-brach Pull-Request-Style Review Pages

When Hazelcast members explicitly configured using DNS names instead of IPv6 addresses, it causes an exception and error 500 on clustering page.

IPv6 only network

# Manually configure hazelcast members
# Use DNS names instead of IP addresses

hazelcast.network.tcpip=true
hazelcast.port=5701
hazelcast.network.tcpip.members=instance-2.my.dns.name:5701,instance-1.my.dns.name:5701
hazelcast.group.name=MyGroup

List of nodes in the cluster.

fields.description:
Users are asking for a Dependency reporting function (the same that Github offer - Please follow this link: https://github.blog/2017-10-11-a-more-connected-universe/#protect-code-with-your-dependency-graph-and-security-alerts)\ )

Here are the features that would be required for this function:

1. We want to have an image of the relations between repositories.
2. We want to be able to focus the dependency graph on 1 or more repositories.
3. We want to be able to view all repository that are affected by a change in the current repository.
4. We want to be able to search the repositories to view which repositories call a specific external dependency.
5. We want to be able to flag repositories that are affected by a CVE security vulnerability.
fields.summary: Can we have a Dependency reporting function implemented in Bitbucket?

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The current wording of the *Minimum successful builds* check can be misleading in certain scenarios. 

For example, in a scenario where you set up '1' as the *Minimum successful builds* required, if there are more than '1' build running, the check will not be successful unless all running builds are successful, even if the minimum of '1' was already fulfilled.

h3. Suggested Solution

* Rename *Minimum successful builds* to *Successful builds*
* Add a description as follows: "Requires the pull request to have successful builds. A commit is valid (mergeable) if it leads to successful builds exclusively."
* Title of the input field: "Least number of successful builds".
* Default value of input field can be 1 (because values < 1 are not supported)
* Description of the input field: "The minimum number of builds that are validating a commit. A commit is valid (mergeable) if it leads to successful builds exclusively."
fields.summary: Improve the wording on the Minimum successful builds merge check

fields.description:
Hi Team,

I am looking for an option to restrict branch creation from a specified branch alone, if the condition is not applied the Branch from option should grey out other branches.

 

For example: If a user wants to create a feature branch, it should be created only from master. If he tries to change that to some other branch like release or custom etc, the option should be disabled. Either the other branches apart from master should be greyed out or should not be displayed in the drop down list.

 

Please let me know if this possible tm implement in Bitbucket server.

 

Thanks,

Sandya.
fields.summary: Restrict GIT branch creation from certain branch

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When datacenter runs in IPv6 only environments, nodes do not join Hazelcast cluster and don't see each other.

h3. Environment

 * IPv6 network with IPv4 traffic disabled

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Bitbucket datacenter in IPv6 only network
 # Configure Hazelcast cluster
hazelcast.network.tcpip=true
hazelcast.port=5701
hazelcast.network.tcpip.members=node1_ip:5701,node2_ip:5701
hazelcast.group.name=MyGroup
hazelcast.group.password=MyPassword

h3. Expected Results
Nodes should join Hazelcast cluster and communicate to each other.

h3. Actual Results
* Nodes do not see each other. 
* Clustering page in server settings shown only one node

h3. Workaround
Edit the file ${BITBUCKET_INSTALL}/bin/_start-webapp.sh and edit the JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARG line to look like this:

{code:java}
JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS="-Dhazelcast.prefer.ipv4.stack=false"
{code}
fields.summary: Datacenter nodes do not join a Hazelcast cluster in IPv6 only environment

fields.description:
Problem Definition
The file filter does not allow for searching for files by exact name. So it is not possible to search for, say, an exact file called _Something.txt_

When the repository contains a large number of files that match the pattern, the specific file may not show up in the top searches.

Expected Result
By some keyword (or quotations), users are able to filter one particular file by its exact name (case-sensitvity optional but may be desired)

Actual Result
File filter users the entered characters to list, in grep/shell style, \*name\*.\*ext\*, as in:
 !FileFilter.png|thumbnail! 

Workaround
{code:bash}
$ cd <git-repo>
$ find . -name Something.txt
{code}
fields.summary: Ability to search for a exact file name using file filter on repository page UI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Upon deleting the *default* branch from the local machine repository there is a warning message from the remote repository which is misleading. 

h3. Environment
Git

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a repository in Bitbucket Server.
 # Clone the repository to the local machine, perform changes and push to Bitbucket Server.
 # Create another branch in Bitbucket Server and fetch the changes to the local repository.
 # Delete the initial(master) branch from the local repository.
{code:java}
git push origin :master
{code}

h5. Message
{code:java}
remote: error: By default, deleting the current branch is denied, because the next
remote: 'git clone' won't result in any file checked out, causing confusion.
remote: 
remote: You can set 'receive.denyDeleteCurrent' configuration variable to
remote: 'warn' or 'ignore' in the remote repository to allow deleting the
remote: current branch, with or without a warning message.
remote: 
remote: To squelch this message, you can set it to 'refuse'.
remote: error: refusing to delete the current branch: refs/heads/master
To http://localhost:7990/scm/proj/repo.git
 ! [remote rejected] master (deletion of the current branch prohibited)
error: failed to push some refs to 'http://admin@localhost:7990/scm/proj/repo.git'
{code}


h3. Expected Results
The terminal in the local machine expected to show the following:
{code:java}
remote: error: refusing to delete the default branch: refs/heads/master
To http://localhost:7990/scm/proj/repo.git
{code}
(i) delete the default branch

h3. Actual Results
The terminal in the local machine showing the following:
{code:java}
remote: error: refusing to delete the current branch: refs/heads/master
To http://localhost:7990/scm/proj/repo.git
{code}
(i) delete the current branch

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Misleading message upon deleting branch

fields.description:
h3. What is this feature request about?

On commit lists I would like to be able to perform basic git actions such as *rebase*, *cherry-pick*, *reset*, and perhaps others.
h3. Why is this important?

By allowing basic git actions to be performed directly within Bitbucket Server this avoids unnecessarily checking out or cloning for basic operations that can be performed in the UI.
h3. Example use cases

1. You've opened a pull request from _{{branch-a}}_ to _{{master}}_. A colleague has pushed up some commits and you would like to *cherry pick* one of those commits to _{{branch-a}}_ so that it becomes part of your pull request.
 2. You've accidentally pushed up some commits to _{{branch-b}}_ that should go to a different branch, so you would like to *cherry pick* those commits to _{{branch-c}}_ and *reset* _{{branch-b}}_ to a previous commit.
 3. You're about to checkout _{{branch-d}}_ but you know that it is now behind _{{master}}_, so you would like to *rebase* _{{master}}_ onto _{{branch-d}}_.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to perform basic git actions on commits

fields.description:
A fix was applied in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BSERV-10608 to truncate to 255 chars for data being inserted into two of the columns on the webhook invocation history table (ie the request URL and the result description fields).

This means there is a bit of a mismatch between the webhook definition (which can have URLs with more than 255 chars) and the invocation history.

This bug is about addressing the mismatch, and making the webhook invocation history columns capable of recording the same size of data as the webhook definition itself.
fields.summary: Webhook invocation history only records first 255 characters of request URL and result description

h3.ISSUE SUMMARY
While trying to search through the the source code view as a user ,in the bitbucket server UI Using cmd+F, it is not possible to scroll down beyond a certain point of the code. The search/find bar occupies a part of the view ,which shifts the code vertically beyond the end of windows height which hides the last few lines . This issue cab ne replicated in multiple browsers 


h3.STEPS TO REPRODUCE 

1. Push a large code , preferrably more than 110 lines to bitbucket server 
2. cmd + F , that will open up the find/search bar in the source view
3. Try to scroll down to the bottom of the code. 

h3.EXPECTED RESULTS 

It should be possible to navigate through the entire code , even if the find/search button is open.

h3.ACTUAL RESULTS
￼
 !image-2019-01-28-11-08-13-273.png|thumbnail! 


This code has 113 lines of code but once the search bar is open it can only scroll up to 110 with the search bar on top.

No workaround found as yet. I tried to change the following arguments in the console but it did not help :

Overflow:hidden to Overflow:scroll
Also tried to adjust the padding-bottom of the body to the height of the footer but nothing changed.

fields.description:
Workflow example:

1) 3 reviewers on PR

2) 1 reviewer "approves" the PR.  2 reviewers mark the PR as "needs work"

3) several non-code related commits against the PR and therefore the "needs work" flags are reset

4) PR looks like it's ready to merge back to master since there is approval, but no "needs work" flags, but it's not

Why does the "needs work" flag clear on every commit, but not the "approve" flag?

 

There should be a flag so that the "needs work" flag is never automatically reset.
fields.summary: Add option to not clear "needs work" flag on PR commit

fields.description: The problem is I can add a project branch restriction to prevent all master branches in all repositories from being altered except for a certain user. Trouble is an admin to any of the repositories can then add a restriction to the branch of that repository for master to allow users to update master within that repository.  I know 'don't give admin' would resolve the issue, but they need admin to add\delete users and their access.  So having a mid level admin (Owner) to allow them to add/remove users to projects and or repositories but not to be able to alter restrictions added by an admin.
fields.summary: Permission level between Admin and Write

fields.description: When I'm editing a source file in Bitbucket using the web client at bitbucket.org, if I accidentally hit refresh or previous page, I lose all the changes that I haven't committed yet. The vast majority of websites, when you're editing something, whether that's code, or a text document, spreadsheet, blog post, status update, whatever, when you press refresh/previous page/next page on your web browser, the website popups with an alert box to tell you haven't finished your editing, are you sure you want to navigate away. And then you get an option for yes I'm sure, do navigate away and an option for no, I'm still editing, don't navigate away. This alert gives you a chance to save yourself in the event that you didn't really mean to leave or if you weren't aware you didn't save. How does Bitbucket not have this basic functionality? That is horrible user experience. Nobody should ever lose work because of a misclick or accident.
fields.summary: Web client GUI source editor needs to popup with warning if page is navigated away from

fields.description:
We have a huge repository (source code of chromium-based browser).

And any file opening takes 20+ seconds while listing a directory is almost instantaneous:

 
{code:java}
time curl "https://$HOST/projects/$PROJECT/repos/REPOSITORY/browse/$RELPATH" > /dev/null
% Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current                                 Dload  Upload   Total   Spent    Left  Speed100 28047    0 28047    0     0   1188      0 --:--:--  0:00:23 --:--:--  6477
real 0m23.633suser 0m0.021ssys 0m0.025s 
{code}
While debugging on the server we observed that it is so slow because of this git call:

 
{code:java}
[18197ms] - Page com.atlassian.bitbucket.commit.CommitService.getCommits(CommitsRequest,PageRequest)
 [18190ms] - /usr/bin/git log --format=commit %H%n%H%x02%P%x02%aN%x02%aE%x02%at%x02%cN%x02%cE%x02%ct%n%B%n%x03END%x04 --no-min-parents --stdin --follow --name-status -- $RELPATH

{code}
This means that while generating webpage Bitbucket fetches entire history of the file. And this webpage does not display full history anywhere. I suppose full history can be used in two places on that webpage:
 # Last commit and committer. There is no need to fetch full history for that. We can add "-1" to "git log" call, which makes it 10x faster for our repository.
 # History button. It is also very slow, I suppose another `git log` is called.
fields.summary: Opening a file is too slow

When a user deletes entered text, the list of branches is refreshed to default view. This is expected. However, when a user clicks on the 'x' on the right side of the text field to delete the entered text, the entered text disappears, but the list of branches is not refreshed.

Issue is not reproducible on Chrome, Firefox or Safari

h3. Environment

* Microsoft Edge -- so Windows 10

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a repo, go to the 'Branches' page
# On the branch dropdown, enter a text to search and filter the branches on the list
# Click on the 'x' on the right side of the text box to remove the entered search text

h3. Expected Results

The list of branches on the list gets refreshed 

h3. Actual Results

The list of branches on the list does not get refreshed and still shows the list of branch according to the previously entered text.
 
 !branch-MSEdge.gif!

Allow ability to control Pull Request deletions per repository

fields.description:
When a pull request is being created, there is a 'uniqueness' check performed to make sure that there are no existing pull requests with the exact same from and to refs.

If there is already an existing pull request with the same refs, then the pull request creation is rejected with an error message "Only one pull request may be open for a given source and target branch".


However, if multiple requests are performed at the exact same time with the same refs, it is possible for the uniqueness check to pass (there are no existing pull requests with these refs) and then more than one request gets inserted into the database (the uniqueness is not enforced in the db).

Any subsequent attempt to create a pull request with the same refs will not return the above error message, but instead will return a 500 error code, "query did not return a unique result: 2" (this error is because the uniqueness check assumes there will never be more than 1 entry - but in the scenario just described it *is* possible to have more than 1 entry).


h3. Workaround
There is no workaround necessary
fields.summary: Attempting to create several instances of the same pull request at the same time can give a 500 error code

fields.summary: Support markdown in code insight reports

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

When using code search, the rules for searching for projects/repositories are inconsistent with the rules for searching code. For repositories, names which contain periods or underscores are not partial matched. The Elasticsearch standard tokenizer used for repository names doesn't consider "." or "_" as a word boundary. This is inconsistent with code, which uses a different tokenizer that does word break on some characters and can cause unexpected search results.

*Example* 

A repository named _bitbucket.jira.demo.repo_ does not show up in a search for "jira" or "demo", but would show up in a search for "bitbucket" or "bitbucket.jira" On the other hand, code containing the same text would match on "bitbucket" "jira" "demo" or "repo"

*Suggested Solution* 

Update the tokenizer for projects/repository to work the same as code. This way the rules for searching are the same regardless of what the user is searching for.
fields.summary: Repository and project names in code search do not support partial matches/tokenization consistently with code

fields.description:
*Summary*

There is need for the possibility to change a forked repository to become the upstream repository, and all the internal references to the old upstream to points to the new upstream.

*Use Case*

For example, there is an upstream repository (*upstream.repo*), and with multiple forks, there is a need to rename this upstream repository to *‘upstream.old_repo*’, and then rename one of the forked repository to (*upstream.repo*) the original name of the old upstream repository. By doing this, the forked repository now becomes the new upstream repository.

To enable all references from CI/CD tools referencing the previous upstream to remain consistent with the new upstream, the internal references of the previous upstream should now be the same for the new upstream.
fields.summary: Ability to make a fork replace the upstream repository

curl -u fkraemer -X GET -H "Content=Type: application/json" 'http://localhost:7990/rest/api/1.0/users?permission=LICENSED_USER&limit=10000'
Enter host password for user 'fkraemer':
{"size":2,"limit":10000,"isLastPage":true,"values":[{"name":"admrodrigo","emailAddress":"admin@admin.com","id":162,"displayName":"Rodrigo Adami","active":true,"slug":"admrodrigo","type":"NORMAL","links":{"self":[{"href":"http://localhost:7990/users/admrodrigo"}]}},{"name":"bamboo.user0000","emailAddress":"bamboo.user0000@atlassian.com","id":1312,"displayName":"bamboo.user0000","active":true,"slug":"bamboo.user0000","type":"NORMAL","links":{"self":[{"href":"http://localhost:7990/users/bamboo.user0000"}]}}],"start":0}
{code}

h3. Expected Results
The same 8 users should have been retrieved.

h3. Actual Results
Only 2 users were retrieved.

h3. Workaround
Use the endpoint {{/rest/api/1.0/admin/license}} suggested under Resolutions section of [KB - How do I find which users count against my Bitbucket Server license?|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserverkb/how-do-i-find-which-users-count-against-my-bitbucket-server-license-779171685.html].
fields.summary: REST API: When limit parameter is used on user resource /rest/api/1.0/users unreliable results are retrieved

fields.description:
Currently the only way to add reviewers to pull requests is by adding the reviewers individually, it would be really useful if Bitbucket server could support addition of user groups as reviewers. This is especially useful on large projects and inner source projects.

The same should be extended to the default reviewers feature on the repositories.
fields.summary: Add the ability to leverage User Groups on Pull Requests

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The current _HttpHostingStatistics_ and _SshHostingStatistics_ do not provide any performance data for git clone or fetch requests. 

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be beneficial to have additional counter attributes for git clone and fetch operations that provide data on performance, like the minimum, mean and maximum request time or percentiles.

Some of this data is already available in the Bitbucket profiler log, but it would be helpful to have all this data as part of JMX monitoring.
fields.summary: Provide better performance JMX metrics for git operations

fields.description:
Right now in Bitbucket version 5.x we are able to set up Default and Mandatory reviewers for the project as a whole. Merge checks are also repository level. It would be a great addition if the User who creates the Pull Request is allowed to specify a custom set of Mandatory Reviewers for every PR that is created. 

There should also be a chance given to reviewed, where they can mark any bitbucket licensed user either mandatory or optional or with no reviewer. There shouldn't be a need to set the minimum level of review, this will also depend upon how many mandatory reviewers are tagged against each pull request.
fields.summary: Allow option to specify mandatory reviewers for each pull request

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Users should be unable to generate their own personal access tokens if this feature mismatches with security policies of their organization. For instance if all users are supposed to perform any action by entering their username/password. An ability to toggle between enabling and disabling Generation of personal access tokens is required.
h3. Workaround

Personal token creation could be disabled by setting {{plugin.bitbucket-access-tokens.max.tokens.per.user}} to {{0}} in the [bitbucket.properties configuration file|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/bitbucket-server-config-properties-776640155.html] for the server.
fields.summary: Ability to disable generation of Personal Access Tokens

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of November 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this bug. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and how to reproduce this issue.

We fixed numerous subtle bugs in the rescoping process and this has resulted in a significant reduction of this problem in our internal environments. We encourage to upgrade to any of the fix versions mentioned in this ticket and provide feedback if the issues have been resolved. 

In addition, take a look at [^BSERV-Howtoself-serviceanddebugrescopingproblems-051120-0256.pdf] for more information about what exactly has been fixed and ways to further diagnose and fix this class of problems.

Cheers,
Wolfgang Kritzinger

Senior Developer - Bitbucket Server
{panel}

h3. Issue Summary
When merging a pull request, the user received the following message:
{noformat}
New changes were pushed to <branch> in <project>/<repository> while the merge was being performed. Please retry the merge.
{noformat}

While this is expected when a change occurs on the target branch during the merge, this can occur also when no changes are received.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
This has been noticed in busy environments.

h3. Expected Results
The merge completes successfully.

h3. Actual Results
The merge does not complete.

There are no exception in the logs, this message is only logged at debug level
{noformat}
com.atlassian.bitbucket.scm.MergeException: New changes were pushed to <branch> in <project>/<repository> while the merge was being performed. Please retry the merge
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Decline and reopen the pull request before attempting to merge again.
fields.summary: Pull request merges fail with the "New changes were pushed to <branch> in <project>/<repository> while the merge was being performed. Please retry the merge." message

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unexpected removal of a Smart Mirror may result with overloading all nodes of the upstream cluster

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Copy your Bitbucket Home and the database from Production to Staging
The copied database references a Production Mirror
# Start Bitbucket Data Center in Staging (for this exercise, a single node is sufficient)
# Login to Bitbucket Data Center in Staging and see the list of existing Mirrors
The Production Mirror should be listed
# Using the web interface, Remove the Production Mirror from Staging

h3. Expected Results
# The Mirror should be unreferenced from Staging, but not removed from Production
# If the Mirror _is_ unexpectedly removed from Production, the Production cluster should _not_ overload itself trying to contact the removed Mirror

h3. Actual Results
# Removing the Production Mirror from Staging sends a REMOVE message to the Mirror
# The Mirror removes itself from its upstream cluster (which is the Production cluster!)
# For the Production cluster, the Mirror's removal is unexpected.
All the Production nodes attempt to contact the removed Mirror. These attempts fail, and are repeated again and again, to the point of overloading the entire Production cluster (all nodes), making it unresponsive.

The below message is logged in the Mirror's atlassian-bitbucket-access.log file:
{noformat}
INFO  [httpclient-callbacks:thread-985] @1IP3TKx1221x58x0 ##.##.##.##,##.##.##.## "HEAD /status HTTP/1.1" c.a.b.i.m.m.DefaultUpstreamService Setting upstream state for @@@@@@@@-@@@@-@@@@-@@@@-@@@@@@@@@@@@ to REMOVED
{noformat}


h3. Workaround
# Using the firewall, or each node's /etc/hosts file, ensure a complete isolation of the Staging environment from the Production environment.
# Before starting the Staging cluster, modify the database, to remove the reference to the existing Production Mirror:
{code}
DELETE FROM plugin_setting WHERE key_name LIKE 'acnct.bitbucket.mirror.%'
{code}
NOTE: While this seems to be working as expected, it is not a supported approach, and it may only be used in an isolated Staging environment.
fields.summary: Mirror's unexpected removal may overload the upstream cluster

fields.description:
When reading a pull request/ commit code if the code is long you need to scroll far up in order to read which file is this code belongs to.

It would be much better to freeze (like in excel) the file path and name header.
fields.summary: Freeze file name and path when scrolling a pull request/commit data

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The current statistics for the number of projects provided by JMX monitoring does not differentiate between personal and regular projects. 

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be beneficial to have two additional JMX counters to make a distinction between personal and regular projects. This would allow a better understanding of the current usage of the Bitbucket instance.
fields.summary: Provide enhanced JMX metrics for counting number of projects

fields.description:
The document [Enabling JMX counters for performance monitoring|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/enabling-jmx-counters-for-performance-monitoring-776640189.html] says the jmx.access file should be created with content like so:
{quote}2. Edit the jmx.access file to include this property and save the file.

monitorRole=<password>
{quote}
Note the user/role and password is separated with an equals sign.

However the Java documentation, specifically [Java 8 - Monitoring and Management Using JMX Technology|https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/technotes/guides/management/agent.html] provides an example that suggests the two should be separated by a space:
{quote}Example 2-1 An Example Password File
 # specify actual password instead of the text password
 monitorRole password
 controlRole password{quote}
On the Oracle Java 8 JRE the example provided in the Atlassian documentation works fine, either a space or "=" separator appear to work equally well. However on the Oracle OpenJDK Java 11 JRE the "=" separator does not. Attempts to log in with the expected password fail with an authentication error.

This is not a problem in Bitbucket 5.16 and earlier, since only Java 8 is supported. However as of Bitbucket Server 6.0, Java 11 will be supported and as such any instance that uses a the "=" separator will find their JMX clients unable to connect to Bitbucket Server.
h3. Workaround

Update any affected jmx.access file to use a space separator instead of "=".
fields.summary: The jmx.access file format is incorrect in document "Enabling JMX counters for performance monitoring"

fields.description:
We are using a mix of APR and JSSE setups between Confluence, Jira, Bamboo and Bitbucket.

Now that Bitbucket Server 5 has moved to a Spring Boot Application with embedde tomcat, i revisited the setup for the embedded tomcat connector with SSL enabled on our side. Our test setup looks like this in bitbucket.properties
{code:java}
server.port=80
server.redirect-port=443
server.require-ssl=true
server.additional-connector.1.port=443
server.additional-connector.1.secure=true
server.additional-connector.1.scheme=https
server.additional-connector.1.protocol=TLS
server.additional-connector.1.ssl.enabled-protocols=TLSv1.2
server.additional-connector.1.ssl.enabled=true
server.additional-connector.1.ssl.ciphers=TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA,TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA,TLS
_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256,TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384,TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA384,TLS_EC
DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
server.additional-connector.1.ssl.key-store=/var/bitbucket-home/keystore.jks
server.additional-connector.1.ssl.key-store-password=changeit
server.additional-connector.1.ssl.key-password=changeit
server.additional-connector.1.ssl.key-store-type=jks
server.additional-connector.1.ssl.keyAlias=keyalias
{code}
These properties are working wonderfully and giving me an A-rating on ssllabs.com tests. However the only thing lacking would be to allow the configuration of `honorCipherOrder`.

This would be a better solution than choosing for APR which is proposed in BSERV-9822

This has been answered by the Spring Boot team on [https://stackoverflow.com/questions/43940608/how-to-set-https-ssl-cipher-suite-preference-in-spring-boot-embedded-tomcat] how to achieve this.

Some changes were proposed in Spring Boot code, but the never made it in ([https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/pull/9223)] so I don't suppose the property will become avaiable on the Ssl spring boot properties class.

Looking at the Bitbucket Server source code, the implementation could be quite trivial, by allowing the `honorCipherOrder` on the `ConnectorProperties` class.

Since `ConnectorProperties` is a `TomcatConnectorCustomizer` the appropriate method on the protocolHandler can be set.

If you would like a patch, I would be happy to provide you with one.
fields.summary: Allow for customization of honorCipherOrder

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Upon running the cURL to reindex the Jira issue key on Bitbucket Server, all the pull request data are missing from AO_777666_JIRA_INDEX table thus Jira does not respond well for branch and pull request in the development panel.

h3. Step to Reproduce
# Perform application link between Bitbucket Server v5.15.0 and Jira v7.12.3.
# Create project and repository on Bitbucket Server.
# Make first commit in the master branch. Then create a new branch called feature/development.
# Make the second commit on branch feature/development. Specify Jira's issue key(eg: SSPJ-101) in the commit message and push to the remote repository.
# Create a pull request from branch feature/development to master.
# In Jira, go to SSPJ-101 issue key and verify the Development panel information as it should link to branch feature/development, commit hash of the second commit and pull request.
# Run the reindex cURL command:
{code:java}
curl -v -u <admin> -p -H "Accept: application/json" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d "{}" http://localhost:7990/rest/jira-dev/1.0/projects/<proj_key>/repos/<repo_slug>/reindex
{code}

(!) *Do not run* this command in a production environment because it causes the Pull requests linked to Jira via an issue key in the commit message not to be displayed in the Development panel and in the details view.

h5. Note
The commit link to the Development Panel, however, is not affected by the reindexing action.

h3. Expected Results
The repository reindexes successful and able to communicate to Jira development panel and data in {{AO_777666_JIRA_INDEX}} not eased.

h3. Actual Results
The data in  {{AO_777666_JIRA_INDEX}} is eased and mess-up the Jira development panel.

h3. Workaround
The changes in pull request's *state* trigger index that allow the development panel to be updated. For example, if an *OPEN* pull request is not present on Jira's Development Panel, changing the pull request state to *DECLINED* and change it back to *OPEN* would reindex the changes and update the Jira's Development Panel to have both branches and pull requests link.
fields.summary: Repository reindex for Jira issue key

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When cloning/pulling via SSH from a mirror, all requests for LFS files get redirected to the Upstream rather than simply converting to an HTTP(s) URL of the Mirror itself. HTTP(s) on the other hand is not affected and successfully retrieves all content from the mirror without the need to contact the upstream.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Add a Mirror to your DC instance and sync a repo with LFS files. Attempt to clone the full repo from the mirror with "CURL_VERBOSE=1" and you will see the connection to the upstream

h3. Expected Results
All content, LFS included, should be downloaded from the mirror. 

h3. Actual Results
Regular Git content is retrieved from the Mirror but once complete, LFS files are then retrieved from upstream.

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround for SSH but you can use HTTP instead to retrieve all files from the Mirror.
fields.summary: When Cloning from a Mirror via SSH, LFS files are Retrieved from Upstream

fields.description:
Scenario: I'm part of a team in a group with admin permission. I'm creating a repository with the team as owner.

Result: I'm added to the user list with admin permission. This becomes a problem once I'm leaving the team. I'll be removed from any groups, with the intention of revoking all access to team repositories. But I'll retain admin privileges for any repo created by myself for that team. If I created 180 repos, the remaining admins will have to open the settings page of all 180 repos and remove me from the user list.

What would I expect: If I'm creating a repo with the team as owner, I should not be added to the repo user list at all.
fields.summary: Do not retain admin privilege for repo created for a team

fields.description:
*Below is actually a bug, not a suggestion, but since creating bugs directly has been disabled (with poor user feedback) and I'm not entitled to contact support, here we go:*

Certain links (ones that look like Jira issue keys?) seem to confuse Bitbucket's markdown parser when the reference link style is used:
{code:none}
- [[TEST-1]] Test 1

[TEST-1]: https://translate.google.com/?text=one

- [[TEST-2]] Test 2

[TEST-2]: https://translate.google.com/?text=two

- [[TEST-3]] Test 3

[TEST-3]: https://translate.google.com/?text=three
{code}
Expected:
 * [TEST-1] Test 1
 * [TEST-2] Test 2
 * [TEST-3] Test 3

Actual:
 * [TEST-1] Test 1
 * [TEST-1] Test 2
 * [TEST-2] Test 3

Since we specifically want to create markdown that works in both PhpStorm, Bitbucket and other viewers, using plain Jira links is not an option.

Haven't checked whether other link styles (e.g. inline) work correctly. They might, but that's not a good alternative for us since those cannot be shared/reused within the same document.

The problem does not occur with different (e.g. lowercase) link keys, e.g. test-1, test-2, test-3.
fields.summary: Markdown: Wrong link references used/shown

fields.description:
In BSERV-9417: Reduce Database load by 'gating' the number of non-critical updates done (fixed in Bitbucket Server 4.13.0) we introduced a "gating" mechanism to prevent issues on the tables that are updated frequently, however this did not include sta_remember_me_token updates.

There are cases being reported where if a VIP has multiple SNAT Ips, it will invalidate the token and cause deadlocks on the database:

{code}
2018-11-25 09:16:32,624 WARN [http-nio-7990-exec-11] *91TLAEx556x281319x3 10.34.113.41,10.33.168.133 "GET /rest/chaperone/1/chaperone/watch-repository HTTP/1.1" o.h.e.jdbc.spi.SqlExceptionHelper SQL Error: 0, SQLState: 40P01
2018-11-25 09:16:32,624 ERROR [http-nio-7990-exec-11] *91TLAEx556x281319x3 10.34.113.41,10.33.168.133 "GET /rest/chaperone/1/chaperone/watch-repository HTTP/1.1" o.h.e.jdbc.spi.SqlExceptionHelper ERROR: deadlock detected
Detail: Process 27867 waits for ShareLock on transaction 320331793; blocked by process 27869.
Process 27869 waits for ShareLock on transaction 320331794; blocked by process 27867.
Hint: See server log for query details.
Where: while deleting tuple (142,56) in relation "sta_remember_me_token"
{code}

Please introduce the same "gating" mechanism that was inplemented on BSERV-9417 for updates on sta_remember_me_token
fields.summary: Please introduce the same "gating" mechanism that was inplemented on BSERV-9417 for updates on sta_remember_me_token

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira referencing to amended commit from the pull request. This was due to changes in the commit message to point from one Jira issue key to another. However, after making the changes, the old issue key's Development panel is showing the links to the branch and pull request in the remote repository.

h3. Step to Reproduce
# Make first commit in the master branch. Then create a new branch called feature/development.
# Make the second commit on branch feature/development. Specify Jira's issue key(eg:  SSPJ-101) in the commit message and push to the remote repository.
 # Create a pull request from branch feature/development to master. 
 # In Jira, go to {{SSPJ-101}} issue key and verify the Development panel information as it should link to branch {{feature/development}}, commit hash of the second commit and pull request.
 # Make changes in the second commit using the command "git commit --amend" to point a different Jira issue key(eg: SSPJ-202) and *force push* to the remote repository.
 # On Bitbucket Server, this will update the commit hash while the old commit hash and its message is marked as removed. The pull request is showing the correct information.
 # In Jira in the {{SSPJ-202}} issue key the Development panel is showing the link to branch {{feature/development}}, (new/updated)commit hash of the second commit and pull request.
 # However, on {{SSPJ-101}} issue key the development panel is still showing the link to branch {{feature/development}} and pull request while the commit is absent.

h3. Expected Results
The Jira's {{SSPJ-101}} issue key no longer links branch and pull request of the old commit message reference.

h3. Actual Results
The Jira's {{SSPJ-101}} issue key the development panel is still showing the link to branch {{feature/development}} and pull request while the commit is absent.

h3. Workaround
Delete the pull request prior to step 5, make changes in the second commit using the command "git commit --amend" to point a different Jira issue key. Push the commit *without* the *force/-f* flag to the remote repository. Create a new pull request for the affected branches in the same manner.
fields.summary: Jira referencing to removed commit after amending a commit

fields.description:
h3. Problem

The solutions offered to deal with the fork searching problem do not provide what our fork based development process really needs. Ideally, our users would like to be able to BY DEFAULT (that is, without specifying fork:false ALMOST EVERY time they search), but have the ability to search forks when they need to. 

Currently, we have decided to [Configure the Bitbucket code search index to exclude all forks|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/configure-bitbucket-s-code-search-index-913477078.html] to help the users avoid having to specify {{fork:false}} every time. 

Providing a server wide default on whether to return fork results by default will be a huge help for us and our user base.
fields.summary: Provide a Server-Wide option to exclude fork results in code searches

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When opening a pull request ({{overview}}, {{diff}} or {{commits}} tab), a 500 error is displayed and the details are not loaded.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add the following string to the description:
{noformat}
************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************
{noformat}
# Save the change to the description


h3. Expected Results
The pull request loads successfully.

h3. Actual Results
The pull request does not load.

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-bitbucket.log file:
{noformat}
ERROR [http-nio-7990-exec-1] <user> <request> <ip> "GET /projects/<project>/repos/<repository>/pull-requests/<pull request id>/overview HTTP/1.1" o.a.c.c.C.[.[.[.[springMvc] Servlet.service() for servlet [springMvc] threw exception
java.lang.StackOverflowError: null
at java.util.regex.Pattern$BmpCharProperty.match(Pattern.java:3799)
at java.util.regex.Pattern$GroupHead.match(Pattern.java:4660)
at java.util.regex.Pattern$Loop.match(Pattern.java:4787)
at java.util.regex.Pattern$GroupTail.match(Pattern.java:4719)
at java.util.regex.Pattern$Curly.match0(Pattern.java:4281)
at java.util.regex.Pattern$Curly.match(Pattern.java:4236)
at java.util.regex.Pattern$BmpCharProperty.match(Pattern.java:3800)
at java.util.regex.Pattern$GroupHead.match(Pattern.java:4660)
at java.util.regex.Pattern$Loop.match(Pattern.java:4787)
at java.util.regex.Pattern$GroupTail.match(Pattern.java:4719)
at java.util.regex.Pattern$Curly.match0(Pattern.java:4281)
at java.util.regex.Pattern$Curly.match(Pattern.java:4236)
at java.util.regex.Pattern$BmpCharProperty.match(Pattern.java:3800)
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
There could be other strings leading to this behaviour. The exact description causing the problem can be detected by using the following rest API and inspecting the {{description}} field in the resulting Json.
{noformat}
rest/api/1.0/projects/<project>/repos/<repository>/pull-requests/<pull request id>
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Update the pull request by editing the description using the REST API
# Get the current {{version}} field from the {{GET rest/api/1.0/projects/<project>/repos/<repository>/pull-requests/<pull request id>}}
# Update the pull request by using the same endpoint (with PUT as a method)
{noformat}
curl --user username:password -H "Content-Type: application/json" --data @input.json -X PUT <Bitbucket_URL>/rest/api/1.0/projects/<project>/repos/<repository>/pull-requests/<pull request id>
{noformat}
Where the {{input.json}} file contains the following and version is the same value as the one returned by the request above:
{noformat}
{
    "version": 6,
    "description": "expected description"
}
{noformat}
fields.summary: Pull request does not load with a java.lang.StackOverflowError: null exception

fields.description:
Bitbucket versions 5.13.x to 5.16.x will intermittently fail to clone via HTTP if running with a git version earlier than 2.10.0. 
Note: Bitbucket 6.0.0 onwards is unaffected as only git versions 2.11 and higher are supported.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Install a git version < v2.10.0
# Set the following in {{bitbucket.properties}}:
    {{plugin.bitbucket-scm-cache.refs.enabled=true}}
    {{plugin.bitbucket-scm-cache.minimum.free.space=5000000000000}}
# Start up bitbucket and attempt to clone/fetch/pull a repository
 
*Expected Results*
The operation always succeeds

*Actual Results*
The operation intermittently fails with:
{{fatal: http://<repo_url>.git/info/refs not valid: is this a git repository?}}

*Workaround*
Upgrade git to version 2.10.0 or later.
fields.summary: Cloning via HTTP fails intermittently with "*.git/info/refs not valid: is this a git repository?"

fields.description: This is currently a feature using Heroku or other PAAS which I think will give a lot of value to being able to spin up a server and test changes against a predefined, database which should cover cases of unit test and functional testing.
fields.summary: With the ability to run build pipelines for each pull request, which offers a better way to test CI changes, I'll like to suggest adding support for testing versions of a site base on Pull Requests.
users without project specific access can't search Public Projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Repository Integrity Checks will always fail to restore missing repositories. If an instance has missing repositories, when Bitbucket try to retrieve repository objects for missing repositories a HibernateException is thrown.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Not available

h3. Expected Results
Run the integrity check without the exception

h3. Actual Results
The below error appears
{noformat}
2018-12-06 13:54:11,442 ERROR [Caesium-1-3]  c.a.s.i.i.DefaultIntegrityCheckReporter Unable to retrieve repositories with IDs [[1111,222]], from database
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Repository Integrity Checks will always fail to restore missing repositories

fields.description:
In our company we would like to have an option to make pushes to Pull Request shadow branches. This can be useful to allow CI system make some actions over commits proposed for review (e.g. fix commit messages or do autosquash of all !fixup commits).

Similar functionality exist in GitHub: https://help.github.com/articles/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork/

Currently this kind of push is rejected by Bitbucket with a corresponding message:
{code:java}
git push -f origin ${LOCAL_BRANCH}:refs/pull-requests/239/merge

Total 0 (delta 0), reused 0 (delta 0)
remote: You are attempting to update refs that are reserved for Bitbucket's pull request functionality. Bitbucket manages these refs automatically, and they may not be updated by users.
remote: Rejected refs:
remote: 	refs/pull-requests/239/merge
{code}
Could you support this functionality?
fields.summary: Allow push to Pull Request branch shadowed from fork

fields.description:
h4. Problem

Currently Bitbucket's VPAT is quite old and needs updating.
h4. Proposed solution

Perform VPAT compliance testing and make sure Bitbucket Server meets the criteria.

Further reference: [https://www.atlassian.com/accessibility#vpat]
fields.summary: VPAT 2.2 compliance (508)

fields.description:
Summary

When adding a comment to a pull request, using the shortcut keys Control-Shift-P, it should display a preview of the text entered in the textarea, and if it is a markdown, it should render the markdown as if I had clicked the "Preview" button below the textarea. This is not the case with Firefox Browser, instead, it opens up a new tab for private browsing.
fields.summary: Shortcut key Ctrl+Shift+P  fails on Firefox

fields.description: We are currently able to render markdown files on the UI. However a preview option is not available for the same during editing. It will be good to preview the changes before commit, so that no commit mistakes are made with invalid Markdown syntax such as missing closing brackets.
fields.summary: Ability to preview markdown(.md) files during editing in the UI

fields.description:
The review UI on Github was way easier to use. You could just scroll through the list of files/changes and you were done at the end of the page. On BitBucket when there are multiple files it is a lot of left and right to select the next files and to make that worse the file tree also becomes scrollable which makes it even harder to keep an overview. Also the scroll events sometime are detected wrongly so the wrong area starts scrolling. E.g. mouse pointer is over the file list and when scrolling the code/diff starts scrolling... Also when you are done you have to go all the way up again to be able to mark your review OK (or not). Github UI is way better in that process, if all is OK the next steps are at the bottom of the page.

Will the Server version be on par with the Cloud version and if yes when?
fields.summary: Bitbucket Code Review UI on par with Cloud version

fields.description:
A {{ProjectPermissionModificationRequestedEvent}} is not raised when changing the default permission of a project from "No Access" to something else.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a project and set the default project permission to "No Access".
 # Add an event listener (e.g. to a plugin) which listens to {{ProjectPermissionModificationRequestedEvent}} and logs a message when the listener is triggered.
 # Change the default project permission from "No Access" to something else (e.g. {{PROJECT_READ}}).

h3. Expected

A {{ProjectPermissionModificationRequestedEvent}} is raised (and a message is logged via the event listener).
h3. Actual

No {{ProjectPermissionModificationRequestedEvent}} is raised (and no message is logged via the event listener).

Note changing the default project permission from {{PROJECT_READ}} to {{PROJECT_WRITE}} or vice versa _does_ raise the {{ProjectPermissionModificationRequestedEvent}}. Only changing the permission to or from "No Access" does not raise the event.
fields.summary: ProjectPermissionModificationRequestedEvent not raised when setting default project permission

fields.description:
PR's seem to sometimes understand that a file is copied and changed, but not always.
Therefore I would like to suggest the option to link a file that is marked as "new" to its source.
This would allow the creator of the PR to help the reviewer see what was changed after the copy.
While I understand that copies are not best practice, I've seen it too often, where reviews become more tedious than necessary.

fields.description:
Hi,

I have a use case. Please review it and let me know if I am on the correct path or not.

We have decided to write our Test Cases ( Human format ) on Trello Card wise.

So Basically 1 Requirement = 1 Card and this card will list all the test cases related to that requirement only. ( this is just proposition, it can be anything else, if purpose is getting achieved).

I want to have a system like whenever any developer does a pull request of his branch into "dev" branch, there should be some mechanism which will get the trello card link from the commit message, automatically check if checklist points are CHECKED or not. IF Yes allow to merge the pull request else deny it.

This is just proposition, suggestions are welcome.

 

Thanks,
fields.summary: Merge Pull Requests after checking trello checklists
Please add Flutter as the Language selection

fields.description:
Is there any way to add additional namespaces (prefixes) to the Branching Model?  We at Intel would like to add additional namespaces/prefixes, but there appears to be no way to do so.   We realize users can select the 'Custom' Branch Type and enter a new value, but we'd like to have something enforced by the tool rather than by process.

Also, is there a way to change the values in the Branch Type drop-down list?  For example, we'd like to rename Release to Program.  We can change the prefix from 'release/' to 'program/', but when creating a new branch 'Release' still shows up in the Branch Type drop-down, but creates a branch with the 'program/' prefix.  Thanks.
fields.summary: New Branch Model namespaces/prefixes

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The quoted user mention syntax causes incorrect escaping in code blocks that occur in:
 - pull request comments
 - pull request description
 - Markdown (md) files

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the following text to one of the following:

 - pull request comments
 - pull request description
 - Markdown (md) files

{noformat}
```cs
var s1 = "c:\test\\zoo\\";
var s2 = @"c:\test\bar\\baz";
```
{noformat}
The specific sequence of characters required to experience this behaviour is the 'at' symbol followed by a double quote and some content that contains backslashes e.g. {{@"hello\world"}}
h3. Expected Results

The text is displayed in the following way:
{code:java}
var s1 = "c:\test\\zoo\\";
var s2 = @"c:\test\bar\\baz";
{code}
h3. Actual Results

The text is displayed like this:

+Pull request comment+
 !markdown_pullRequestComment.png|width=300!

+Pull request details+
 !markdown_pullRequestDetails.png|width=300!

+Markdown file+
 !markdown_FileContent.png|width=300!
h3. Workaround

If it is acceptable to use single quotes, surrounding the string following the {{@}} with single quotes will prevent this from occurring. 

It is also possible to double-escape the backslashes, however note that once this bug is fixed, that double escape will likely no longer apply.
fields.summary: "@" character followed by double quote containing string escapes content within the string in Markdown

fields.description:

fields.description:
This was split from BSERV-11472 where the suggestions were:
 - It would be interesting to integrate Code Insights with the Jenkins Warnings plugin. I don't know whether anyone is working on that.

 - -Jenkins has a feature that locally merges a pull request and then builds the result. I wonder if the annotations from that build could be usefully displayed by Bitbucket Server. It could result in more accurate annotations, but it would require the merge to be done in the same way on both servers, thus perhaps requiring the same version of Git.-  
 ** As of Bitbucket Server 7.0 this is not possible as Bitbucket Server will show the common ancestor diff, and not contain any merged lines
 - -I see Bitbucket Server is already publishing refs with names like "refs/pull-requests/45/merge". If Jenkins (specifically the Bitbucket Branch Source plugin) used this instead of doing its own merge, it could then add the resulting Code Insights report to the automatic merge commit already known by Bitbucket Server. Alas, it seems Bitbucket Server 5.15.1 does not display Code Insights reports from such a commit in the open pull request that caused the automatic merge.-
 ** As of Bitbucket Server 7.0 this is not possible as Bitbucket Server will show the common ancestor diff, and not contain any merged lines. Additionally, `refs/pull-requests/*` are not part of public API and could change at any time
fields.summary: Better Code Insights <-> Jenkins integration

fields.description:
Currently, annotations are only shown on added or modified lines in a pull request.

This missed lots of use cases (e.g. unused imports).

 

This was split from BSERV-11472 where the use case was:
{quote}In particular, I can imagine making our build server validate hyperlinks between Markdown files and report any dangling references to Code Insights. Then, if someone deletes a file or anchor that is the target of a hyperlink, that will cause a Code Insights annotation on the hyperlink; but Bitbucket Server will not display this annotation because line containing the hyperlink was not modified.
{quote}
fields.summary: Show code insight annotations on all lines of changed files in a pull request

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The following symptoms are observed:
- Mirror: any git operation fails with {{fatal: Authentication failed}} errors when performing any git operation
- Primary/Upstream: the application link overview page shows a "Non Atlassian" application link

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Not available / currently under investigation

h3. Expected Results
The mirror is always successfully working.

h3. Actual Results
Git operations from the mirror fail while the primary/upstream is fully functional.

A unique set of log lines that can be related to this issue has not been identified yet, but in some instances the following logs have been identified in the primary:
{noformat}
ERROR [http-nio-7990-exec-20] addon_bitbucket.mirror.btuq-tz6u-2ty4-4nts *1H1PNVRx1279x5128x1 <request_ip> "PUT /rest/mirroring/latest/mirrorServers/BTUQ-TZ6U-2TY4-4NTS HTTP/1.1" c.a.p.c.p.l.ConnectAddonInstaller An exception occurred while installing the plugin '[bitbucket.mirror.btuq-tz6u-2ty4-4nts]. Restoring previous version...
java.lang.NullPointerException: null
{noformat}


h3. Workaround
- Delete the "unexpected / non Atlassian" application link
- Delete the mirror from the UI
- Re-register the mirror with the primary
- Restart the mirror


h3. Notes
In the versions 6.0.0, 5.14.3, 5.15.2, 5.16.1, 5.12.4, 5.13.4, 5.11.4 and 5.10.4 an hardening mechanism has been introduced to reduce the occurrence of these cases (in particular when two mirrors are trying to upgrade the connect add on at the same time). This, however, did not cover all the scenarios so the ticket has been reopened on the 18th of April.
fields.summary: Mirror reports "fatal: Authentication failed" errors when performing any git operation

fields.description:
Hi Team!
 There's quite awesome feedback from Kalle, one of our customers:
 - It would be nice to see Code Insights reports on individual commit pages too, not only in pull requests.

 - Displaying annotations only on changed lines seems rather restrictive. In particular, I can imagine making our build server validate hyperlinks between Markdown files and report any dangling references to Code Insights. Then, if someone deletes a file or anchor that is the target of a hyperlink, that will cause a Code Insights annotation on the hyperlink; but Bitbucket Server will not display this annotation because line containing the hyperlink was not modified.

 - It would be interesting to integrate Code Insights with the Jenkins Warnings plugin. I don't know whether anyone is working on that.

 - Jenkins has a feature that locally merges a pull request and then builds the result. I wonder if the annotations from that build could be usefully displayed by Bitbucket Server. It could result in more accurate annotations, but it would require the merge to be done in the same way on both servers, thus perhaps requiring the same version of Git.

Follow up comment by Kalle:
 Actually, I see Bitbucket Server is already publishing refs with names like "refs/pull-requests/45/merge". If Jenkins (specifically the Bitbucket Branch Source plugin) used this instead of doing its own merge, it could then add the resulting Code Insights report to the automatic merge commit already known by Bitbucket Server. Alas, it seems Bitbucket Server 5.15.1 does not display Code Insights reports from such a commit in the open pull request that caused the automatic merge.
 - I was surprised to see that Bitbucket Server displays the links of annotations as "View on TITLE", where TITLE comes from the "title" parameter of the report. It means the report title practically has to be the name of a web site, rather than the name of software that generated the annotation.

Best regards,
 Tomasz Tokarczuk
 Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Code Insights feedback

fields.description:
When trying to set up a new mirror, an admin needs to approve the mirroring request on the primary server. If The user double- or triple- clicks the "Approve" button, the  REST request to accept the mirroring request is sent multiple times in quick succession. The backend does not handle this gracefully and this can result in issues with mirror installation.

The frontend should disable the Approve button once it has been clicked once.

This issue has affected a customer running 5.3.x, and I've been able to reproduce it on our latest version as well.
fields.summary: The frontend should not send the request to accept a mirror twice

fields.description: Bitbucket server supports linking to specific lines of files in the browse view, with each line number in the gutter having an anchor. It is sometimes useful to be able to link to a specific part of a change, e.g. when discussing what one small part of a larger commit made. Unfortunately, the commit view lacks anchors for line numbers in its gutter. Please consider adding that.
fields.summary: Line number anchors in commit view

fields.description:
All files on a commit or merged PR are immutable, this should be reflected in their HTTP cache directive. Why is this important?

As a user I'm working with spotty wifi / no wifi / limited bandwidth / slow connection / etc. I've successfully downloaded this file, I want it to still be there if I flip between two files in the PR. If I lose the first file when flip back because this is the moment wifi goes out I've lost productive time.

Please use 
Cache-Control: immutable
fields.summary: Cache Immutable - PR/Commit files

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The user interface in Bitbucket does not load with its entire content as shown in the screenshot below:
!image-2018-11-29-10-48-05-025.png|width=627,height=311!



h3. Environment
* Chrome as browser
* Redux DevTools installed

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Bitbucket in Chrome

h3. Expected Results
The user interface successfully loads.

h3. Actual Results
The Bitbucket pages don't load as expected:
!image-2018-11-29-10-48-05-025.png|width=627,height=311!

The following error can be found in the console:
{code:java}
Uncaught Error: you may not call store.getState() while the reducer is executing. The reducer has already received the state as an argument. Pass it down from the top reducer instead of reading it from the store. {code}
 
h3. Notes
(i) This is a bug in v2.16.2 of the *Redux DevTools* Chrome extension.

To fix, please reinstall (or remove) the Redux DevTools Chrome extension: https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/redux-devtools/lmhkpmbekcpmknklioeibfkpmmfibljd?hl=en 

For more info, see: https://github.com/zalmoxisus/redux-devtools-extension/issues/596
fields.summary: Bitbucket Server fails to load in Chrome due to a JS error in redux.js
